content.question: Which of the following describes a possible method that can check the power of the president who willingly violates the constitutional balance of power as described in the passage?

choices.label: Congress can pass a law that removes the president from office.
The Supreme Court can rule that the presidential election results are null and void based on the actions of the president.
States can recall the president through a special election process.
Congress can impeach and remove a president who is unable or unwilling to perform his or her official functions.

content.answer: Congress can impeach and remove a president who is unable or unwilling to perform his or her official functions.
